intro: Platyclinis barbifrons, commonly known as the barbed flatleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and distinctive barbed edges on its stems. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Platyclinis barbifrons is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
